class_notes:
Topic: The South and the Archive
Course Description: This course invites students to read, research, and write about some of the most influential writers, texts, and concepts regarding the US South. We will read novels, short stories, poems, and essays, as well as explore archival materials related to the South and its literature. Potential authors include William Faulkner, George Washington Cable, Mark Twain, Langston Hughes, Zora Neale Hurston, Flannery O'Connor, Eudora Welty, Alice Walker, Lafcadio Hearn, and more. This is a research and archival focused class that will require in-person attendance and participation. We will be making multiple trips to the Stuart A. Rose Library and navigating the extensive resources Emory Libraries has to offer.
course_description: The development of Southern literature with representative works by writers such as Mark Twain, Cable, Glasgow, Chesnutt, Faulkner, Welty, O'Connor, and Percy.
